features.name: a[download] attribute
features.summary: When used on an <a>, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigating to it.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Ambient Light Events
features.summary: Ambient Light Event API which is a handy way to make a web page or web app aware of any change in light intensity.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: Application Cache
features.summary: Enables web pages to work without the user being connected to the internet
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: ARIA Landmark Roles
features.summary: Support for ARIA roles indicating regions of the page intended as navigational landmarks.

features.name: ARIA role 'none'
features.summary: Support for the 'none' ARIA role to indicate an element whose implicit native role semantics should not be mapped to the accessibility API.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: Arrow function
features.summary: The arrow (=>) provides a shorthand for the function keyword with lexical 'this' binding.

features.name: ASM.js
features.summary: Performance options for a low-level subset of JavaScript, including recognition of the 'use asm' directive and ahead-of-time compilation.

features.name: Audio tracks
features.summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple audio tracks, and switch between them using the AudioTrack.enabled attributes.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Battery Status API
features.summary: Allows access to see the battery level of the device's battery
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Beacon
features.summary: Enables web applications to asynchronously transfer data from the user agent to a web server, with the user agent taking the responsibility to eventually send the data.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Blob
features.summary: Allows you to construct Blobs directly (var blob = new Blob(["1234"], {type: 'text/plain'})). Blob() constructor also can take ArrayBufferview directly rather than constructing a blob with ArrayBuffer.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Block bindings (let, const, function)
features.summary: Allows developers to explicitly qualify access to variables within a block.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Box Alignment
features.summary: CSS properties for aligning boxes within their container. Allows for true vertical centering among other features.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Canvas
features.summary: Provides an API to draw 2D graphics
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Canvas2D text decoration
features.summary: Add a textDecoration attribute to canvas 2D contexts, behavior similar to existing "font" attribute: It's a DOMString, parsed the same way as corresponding CSS property (text-decoration).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Canvas focus ring
features.summary: Adds APIs to the canvas 2D context that make it possible to draw a focus ring around a canvas path and notify the Operating system of the bounding box of the focused object for accessibility.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Classes (ES6)
features.summary: Syntax for declaring classes.

features.name: Clipboard API
features.summary: Standard APIs for interacting with the clipboard (copy/cut/paste Operations). ie currently supports a legacy model for clipboard access.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Compositing and Blending in Canvas 2D
features.summary: The canvas 2d context has the globalCompositeOperation attribute that is used to set the current compositing and blending Operator.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Conditional Rules
features.summary: Support for the @supports at-rule and the "window.CSS.supports()" API

features.name: Console Logging APIs
features.summary: APIs to log messages to a connected developer tool. Covering console.assert, console.log, console.info, console.warn, console.error, console.debug, console.dir, console.dirxml.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: console.table
features.summary: console.table allows the logging of tabular data to a connected developer tool.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Content Security Policy
features.summary: Allows you to create an allow list of sources of trusted content, and instructs the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

features.name: Cross-Domain Font Loading
features.summary: Increases interOperability with the web by relaxing domain and licensing metadata restrictions for EOT, WOFF, and TrueType fonts. Development work for ie is currently for Windows Phone only.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: CSS calc()
features.summary: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. width: calc(100% - 3em)
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: CSS Device Adaptation
features.summary: The @viewport rule, in combination with media queries, enabled web developers to optimize the layout of sites and apps for different devices with minimal effort. It generalizes the viewport meta tag to CSS, while being much simpler to understand and without the quirks that exists with the meta tag.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: CSS filter() image function
features.summary: The function allows filtering an CSS input image with a set of filter functions. The used filter functions are the same as for the CSS filter property. The filter() function can be animated as well.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS font-stretch
features.summary: Add support for the CSS font-stretch property.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: CSS Gradient Midpoints
features.summary: Allows specifying an optional location between the color stops of a CSS gradient.

features.name: CSS intial value
features.summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the initial keyword, the propertyâ€™s initial value becomes its specified value.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS Intrinsic Sizing
features.summary: Extends the CSS sizing properties with keywords that represent content-based "intrinsic" sizes and context-based "extrinsic" sizes, allowing CSS to more easily describe boxes that fit their content or fit into a particular layout context.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS Logical Properties Level 1
features.summary: Introduces logical properties and values that provide the author with the ability to control layout through logical, rather than physical, direction and dimension mappings.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSSOM view smooth scroll API
features.summary: Adds an optional argument to existing scroll APIs that specifies whether scrolling should be smooth. Also adds a CSS property for this.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS pointer-events
features.summary: Enables control of whether an element can receive input events from a pointing device using an API similar to the existing pointer-events property from SVG.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: CSS Scrolling Snap Points
features.summary: Enables rich, customizable, and performant scrolling experiences like pagination of carousels by using snap points that enforce the scroll offsets that a scroll container may end at after a scrolling Operation has completed.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: CSS touch-action
features.summary: New CSS property to enable websites to declaratively state how touches should be handled for purposes of scrolling and zooming.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: CSS Transforms - preserve-3d
features.summary: Augments existing CSS 3d transforms by facilitating the construction of complex 3d scenes.

features.name: CSS Transitions & Animations for SVG elements
features.summary: Allows CSS Transitions and Animations to apply to SVG elements.

features.name: CSS unset value
features.summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the â€˜â€˜unsetâ€™#â€™ keyword, then if it is an inherited property, this is treated as â€˜inheritâ€™, and if it is not, this is treated as â€˜initialâ€™. This keyword effectively erases all declared values occurring earlier in the cascade, correctly inheriting or not as appropriate for the property (or all longhands of a shorthand).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS Variables
features.summary: Introduces cascading variables as a new primitive value type that is accepted by all CSS properties, and custom properties for defining them.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: CSS Will Change
features.summary: Adds a will-change CSS property, that can be used to signal that a particular property is likely to be changed in the future, or that an element's content is likely to change.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Custom Elements
features.summary: Method for registering (creating) custom elements in script (often used in Web Components).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Custom filters (shaders)
features.summary: Filter effects are a way of processing an elementâ€™s rendering before it is displayed in the document.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: <datalist> Element
features.summary: Shows a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user when entering an input element.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Date related input types
features.summary: Input controls for picking dates via <input type='date'>,<input type='month'>, and <input type='week'>.

features.name: Default parameter
features.summary: Allows formal parameters to be initialized with default values if no value is passed.

features.name: Destructuring
features.summary: Destructuring assignment allows extracting data from arrays or objects using a syntax that mirrors array and object literals.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: <details>/<summary>
features.summary: Interactive widget to show/hide content.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Device Motion
features.summary: Provides access to device's physical motion.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Device Orientation
features.summary: Provides access to device's physical orientation
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: devicePixelRatio on zoom
features.summary: Update window.devicePixelRatio on full page zoom so that it accurately portrays the ratio between css and device pixels.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: <dialog> element for modals
features.summary: An HTML element for modal and non-modal dialog boxes
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: DOM3 Keyboard Events
features.summary: KeyboardEvent: keydown, keyup, keypress
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: DOM3 mouseenter & mouseleave Events
features.summary: DOM event analog of CSS :hover psuedo-selector that fires as the mouse enters and exits the bounding box of an element (including its children).
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: DOM3 Wheel Events
features.summary: Implementation of the standard DOM Level 3 WheelEvent for mouse wheel rotation.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: DOM Event Constructors
features.summary: Replaces document.createEvent() and associated event object init methods with constructors for each event interface.

features.name: DOM Level 3 XPath
features.summary: Provides simple functionality to access a DOM tree using the XPath syntax.

features.name: dppx Unit for the resolution Media Query
features.summary: One dppx unit represents the number of 'dots' in a CSS px.

features.name: Drag and Drop Directories
features.summary: Allows dragging and dropping entire folders using HTML5 Drag and Drop. Extends the DataTransferItem with a method to get a FileEntry/DirectoryEntry.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: ECMAScript Internationalization API
features.summary: Provides APIs for string comparison and date/time/number formatting in a locale-aware manner.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Efficient Script Yielding - setImmediate()
features.summary: Allows web applications to flush the browser event queue and receive an immediate callback.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Encrypted Media Extensions
features.summary: Defines a common API that may be used to discover, select and interact with such systems as well as with simpler content encryption systems.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: ES6 Numeric Literals
features.summary: Allows binary and octal numeric literals using 0b101 and 0o753 respectively.

features.name: ES6 Object Literal Enhancements
features.summary: Adds computed properties, concise method definitions, and short-hand for properties whose value is initialized to a same-named variable.

features.name: Exclusions
features.summary: Define areas inline content should avoid, and how inline content should wrap around them.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: Fetch API
features.summary: The Fetch specification defines requests, responses, and the process that binds them; fetching.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: FileReader
features.summary: The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: FileWriter
features.summary: Enables writing to files from web applications.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Filters
features.summary: Apply filter effects to arbitrary DOM elements.

features.name: Flexbox
features.summary: A CSS box model optimized for user interface design. The children of a flex container can be laid out in any direction and can "flex" their sizes to fill unused space and  avoid overflowing the parent.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Fullscreen API
features.summary: Programmatically instruct content on the page to be presented in the browser's full screen (kiosk) mode.

features.name: GamePad API
features.summary: Gives JS access to a game controller via USB.

features.name: Generated Content for Paged Media
features.summary: CSS properties helpful for printed publication.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Generators
features.summary: A generator is a special type of function that works as a factory for iterators.

features.name: Geolocation
features.summary: Provides access to device's physical location
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Gradients
features.summary: Gradients provide a method to, over a customizable amount of space, transition from one color to another.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Grid
features.summary: A two-dimensional grid-based layout system, optimized for user interface design.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: Hardware Concurrency
features.summary: An API for reading the system's total number of logical processors available to the user agent, up to an optional thread limit per origin.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: High Resolution Time
features.summary: Enables reliable, high-resolution timing of client-side performance.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: HTML Imports
features.summary: Import HTML documents into other HTML documents (often used in Web Components).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: HTML Sections in Accessibility API
features.summary: Exposes HTML sectioning elements (such as section, article, main, etc.) in the Accessibility API.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: HTTP/2
features.summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content being standardized by the ieTF.

features.name: HTTP Client Hints
features.summary: Header for proactive content negotiation; just as the Accept header allowed clients to indicate what formats they prefer, Client Hints allow clients to indicate a list of device and agent specific preferences.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
features.summary: Expands our plugin-free adaptive video streaming to support the popular HLS protocol for transferring unbounded streams of multimedia data.

features.name: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
features.summary: Header to inform the browser to always request a given domain over SSL, reducing MITM attack surface area.

features.name: iframe[sandbox] attribute
features.summary: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (i.e. no JavaScript) in iframes (<iframe sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-forms" src="..."></iframe>)
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: iframe[seamless] attribute
features.summary: The seamless attribute is used to embed an <iframe> in the calling page without scrollbars or borders (e.g. seamlessly) and with the parent document's styles applying to the embedded seamless iframe.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: iframe[srcdoc] attribute
features.summary: Gives the content of an iframe as a src context to embed (e.g. ).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: IME API
features.summary: Provides Web applications with scripted access to an IME (input-method editor) .
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.summary: Enable a responsive images solution by providing the browser multiple resources in varying resolutions for a single image.

features.name: IndexedDB
features.summary: An asynchronous client-side storage API offering fast access to large amounts of structured data
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: inputmode
features.summary: The inputmode content attribute is an enumerated attribute that specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content into the form control.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: JS iterators (i.e. the for-of feature)
features.summary: Iterates over iterable objects (including arrays, array-like objects, iterators and generators), invoking a custom iteration hook with statements to be executed for the value of each distinct property.

features.name: Karaoke Web Standard
features.summary: Provides semantic language processing for two-way communication with a remote host. This new interface creates a system-to-system forced sonic recognition on the receiving party.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: <keygen> element
features.summary: A form element for a key pair generator control.  Support here indicates UI for picking keys and some transport to submit them. However, significant interOperability issues exist with the DOM interfaces and protocols for this feature.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: <main> element
features.summary: Semantic HTML5 element that represents the main content of the document or application.

features.name: Map
features.summary: Map objects are simple key/value maps.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Masks
features.summary: Allows hiding of portions of a visible elements.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: matchMedia
features.summary: API for testing if a given media query will apply.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Math Built-ins (ES6)
features.summary: Math related functions - sign, trunc, sinh, cosh, tanh, asinh, acosh, atanh, log10, log2, hypot, fround, clz32, cbrt, log1p, expm1.

features.name: MathML
features.summary: An application of XML for describing mathematical notations and capturing both its structure and content.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Media Capture and Streams
features.summary: Provides access to the user's local audio and video input/output devices (getUserMedia API).

features.name: Media Fragments
features.summary: Standardizes a URL fragment syntax for specifying a fragment of a media resource.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Media Queries Level 4: Interaction Media Features (pointer and hover)
features.summary: Allows to query the presence and accuracy of the user's pointing input (e.g. for differentiating touch versus mouse). Additionally, allows the page to query whether the user's pointing input supports hover.

features.name: Media Queries: resolution feature
features.summary: Allows to query the device pixel count per CSS unit
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: MediaRecorder
features.summary: Encode audio and video streams in the browser.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Media Source Extensions
features.summary: Allows appending data to an <audio>/<video> element.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Message Channels
features.summary: A messaging system that allows documents to communicate with each other regardless of their source domain, in a way designed to avoid cross-site scripting attacks.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Meta Referrer
features.summary: Using the referrer metadata attribute, a document can control the behavior of the Referer HTTP header attached to requests that originate from the document.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: Microdata
features.summary: Microdata is used to nest semantics within existing content on web pages.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: mix-blend-mode
features.summary: Provides a way to blend an HTML or SVG element with its backdrop
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Modules (ES6)
features.summary: Language-level support for defining and consuming modules.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Motion JPEG (MJPG)
features.summary: Adds support for the MJPG video format, popular with IP cameras.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: Multi-column (full support)
features.summary: Allows content to be flowed into multiple columns with a gap and a rule between them using CSS.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Mutation Observers
features.summary: Provides notifications when DOM nodes are rearranged or modified.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Navigation Error Logging
features.summary: This specification defines an interface to store and retrieve error data related to the previous navigations of a document.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Navigation Timing API
features.summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to navigation and elements.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Number Built-ins (ES6)
features.summary: New methods and properties on Number, including isFinite, isInteger, isSafeInteger, isNaN, EPSILON, MIN_SAFE_INTEGER, and MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

features.name: Object Built-ins (ES6)
features.summary: New methods on Object including assign, is, getOwnPropertySymbols, and setPrototypeOf

features.name: object-fit and object-position
features.summary: CSS properties that control the position and size of replaced content within the content box
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Object.observe()
features.summary: Observe changes to JS objects.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Page Visibility API
features.summary: Provides an API to ask whether the current tab is visible or not. If so, you might want to throttle back action or set an idle state.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: <picture> Element
features.summary: Enable a responsive images solution by declaring multiple resources for an image using CSS media queries.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Platform for Privacy Preferences 1.0 (P3P 1.0)
features.summary: The Platform for Privacy Preferences Project (P3P) enables web sites to express their privacy practices in a standard format allowing user agents to automate decision-making based on these practices when appropriate.

features.name: Pointer Events
features.summary: Unified pointer input API (e.g. mouse, pen, touch input) which addresses several existing problems (especially on touchscreen laptops) and provides future extensibility.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Pointer Lock (Mouse Lock)
features.summary: Gives access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits of how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view. Obvious use cases are for first person or real time strategy games.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: position: sticky
features.summary: position: sticky is a new way to position elements and is conceptually similar to position: fixed. The difference is that a stickily positioned element behaves like position: relative within its parent, until a given offset threshold is met.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: postMessage
features.summary: Safely enables cross-origin communication.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Prefetch attribute
features.summary: Indicates the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the specified resource.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Prerender attribute
features.summary: Provides a hint to the browser that another page is likely to be loaded by the user (such as the first result of a search) such that it may be prerendered for better performance.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Promises (ES6)
features.summary: Allows easier and cleaner asynchronous coding. Adds the Promise constructor, along with the 'all' and 'race' utility methods to the language itself.

features.name: __proto__ (ES6)
features.summary: Support for legacy prototype manipulation similar to Object.setPrototypeOf.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Proxies (ES6)
features.summary: Proxies are objects for which the programmer has to define the semantics in JavaScript.

features.name: Public Key Pinning Extension for HTTP
features.summary: Certificate public key pinning is a mechanism which allows specifying a key that must be present in the certificate chain associated with a domain name. HTTP Public Key Pinning (HPKP) is one way of doing certificate public key pinning. In this method, site owner defines pin rules for his domain name via HTTP header. This mechanism assumes that user has had a first clean connection to the site.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Push API
features.summary: Provides webapps with scripted access to server-sent notifications.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Quota Management API
features.summary: This API can be used to check how much quota an app/origin is using.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: RegExp Built-ins (ES6)
features.summary: New methods on RegExp.prototype including match, replace, search, and split.

features.name: Regions
features.summary: Magazine-like content flow into specified regions.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: requestAnimationFrame()
features.summary: Offload animation repainting to browser for optimized performance. You should call this method whenever you're ready to update your animation onscreen. This will request that your animation function be called before the browser performs the next repaint.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Resource Priorities
features.summary: Defines a means for site developers to programmatically give the User Agent hints on the download priority of a resource.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Resource Timing API
features.summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to HTML elements.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Rest parameters
features.summary: Allows representation of an indefinite number of arguments as an array.

features.name: Runtime error reporting: ErrorEvent.
features.summary: Unhandled exceptions trigger the 'window.onerror' callback (or 'self.onerror' inside Workers) for centralized handling.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Scoped Styles
features.summary: Boolean attribute for the <style> element (<style scoped>). When present, its styles only apply to the parent element.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Screen Orientation API
features.summary: Provides the ability to read the screen orientation state, to be informed when this state changes, and to be able to lock the screen orientation to a specific state.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: Selection API
features.summary: Based on APIs from HTML5 and DOM Range, this specification includes additional methods for programmatically inspecting and modifying the selection.

features.name: Server-Sent Events (EventSource)
features.summary: Enables push notifications from the server received as DOM events.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Service Worker
features.summary: ServiceWorkers (formerly Navigation Controllers) are a new system that provides event-driven scripts that run independent of web pages. They are similar to SharedWorkers except that their lifetime is different and they have access to domain-wide events such as network fetches.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Set
features.summary: Set objects let you store unique values of any type, whether primitive values or object references.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Shadow DOM (unprefixed)
features.summary: Enables DOM tree encapsulation. Without it, widgets may inadvertently break pages by using conflicting CSS selectors, class or id names, or JavaScript variables (often used in Web Components).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Shapes
features.summary: Define arbitrary shapes inside and around which inline content can flow.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Shared Web Workers
features.summary: A special type of WebWorker that can commincate across windows/tabs for a site.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: showModalDialog
features.summary: The global showModalDialog() method displays a modal dialog box containing a specified HTML document. This feature has an incredibly high cost in terms of code complexity since it requires us to run an event loop on top of an arbitrary JavaScript stack. It also complicates the web platform by making task dispatch reentrant and hard to reason about.

features.name: SIMD (ES7)
features.summary: Enables Single Instruction, Multiple Data instructions to be used from Javascript programs.
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: SPDY/3
features.summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content.

features.name: Spread (ES6)
features.summary: The spread Operator expands iterable expressions into individual arguments. For example, a.b(â€¦array) is roughly the same as a.b.apply(a, array).

features.name: Streams API
features.summary: An API for representing binary data in web applications as a Stream object.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: String Built-ins (ES6)
features.summary: New methods on String including String.raw and String.fromCodePoint. New methods on String.prototype including codePointAt, normalize, repeat, startsWith, endsWith, and includes.

features.name: Subclassing (ES6)
features.summary: Allows subclassing of built-in types such as Dates and Arrays.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Subpixel font scaling
features.summary: Allow sub-css-pixel font-sizes and thus smooth font scaling.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Subresource Integrity
features.summary: Subresource Integrity defines a mechanism by which user agents may verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation. In a nutshell, metadata inlined into HTML elements allows the browser to determine whether the resource that was downloaded matches the resource the page's author expected to download.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: SVG2
features.summary: Implement the new SVG2 features.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: SVG External Content
features.summary: Allows referencing external content in SVG. A common use case for this would be <use xlink:href="lib.svg#template" fill="#000000"></use>
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: SVG foreignobject element
features.summary: Allows for inclusion of a foreign namespace (such as HTML) which has its graphical content drawn by a different user agent
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: SVG+SMIL Animation
features.summary: XML-based syntax for specifying animations of SVG.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Symbols
features.summary: Allows properties to be added to existing objects without the possibility of interference with the existing properties, unintended visibility, or with other uncoordinated additions by any other code.

features.name: Tail Calls (ES6)
features.summary: Enables boundlessly recursive algorithms (using constant stack space) for certain code patterns.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: <template> Element
features.summary: HTML template element to allow creating fragment of inert HTML as a prototype for stamping out DOM (often used in Web Components).
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Template Strings (ES6)
features.summary: String literals that allow for expressions to be evaluated and concatenated with the string literal.

features.name: Time related input types
features.summary: Input controls for picking times via <input type='time'>,<input type='datetime'>, and <input type='datetime-local'>.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: TLS 1.2
features.summary: The latest version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Allows for data/message confidentiality, and message authentication codes for message integrity and as a by-product message authentication.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Touch Events
features.summary: Touchscreen input API, originally introduced by Apple on iOS. Support is currently limited to only devices with a touchscreen (can be overridden in about:flags). See Pointer Events for touch, pen, and mouse input across all device types.

features.name: Track element
features.summary: Add subtitles, captions, screen reader descriptions, chapters and other types of timed metadata to video and audio.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Transforms
features.summary: Enables changing the position of content in 3D space without disrupting the normal flow. See also preserve-3d.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Typed Arrays
features.summary: Buffers for holding binary data and working with WebGL & Audio API: ArrayBuffer, Float32Array , Int16Array, Uint8Array, etc.)
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Uievents - Keyboard Query APIs
features.summary: Identify the physical key being pressed; Query key from layout.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Upgrade insecure resource requests
features.summary: A mechanism which allows authors to instruct a user agent to upgrade a priori insecure resource requests to secure transport before Fetching them.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: URL API
features.summary: Expose constructible URL objects that can be manipulated and combined.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: User Timing API
features.summary: Helps web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Vibration API
features.summary: This specification defines an API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device. Vibration is a form of tactile feedback.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Video tracks
features.summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple video tracks, and switch between them using the VideoTrack.selected attributes.

features.name: WAV Audio Support
features.summary: Enables PCM WAV audio support in HTML5 Audio.

features.name: WeakMap
features.summary: WeakMaps are key/value maps in which keys are objects.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: WeakSet (ES6)
features.summary: Contains a set of objects such that those objects will be collected if they are not referenced anywhere else.

features.name: Web Animations JavaScript API
features.summary: A unified model for supporting animation and synchronization on the Web platform.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web Application Manifest
features.summary: This specification defines a JSON-based manifest, which provides developers with a centralized place to put metadata associated with a web application.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web Audio API
features.summary: A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications

features.name: Web Crypto API
features.summary: JavaScript bindings for cryptographic Operations. Note: we are looking to update our current implementation to the latest W3C Last Call Working Draft specification.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: WebDriver
features.summary: A platform and language-neutral interface and associated wire protocol that allows programs or scripts to introspect into, and control the behaviour of, a web browser.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: WebGL2 (Canvas 3D)
features.summary: 3D rendering via the <canvas> element using an API that conforms closely to the OpenGL ES 3.0 API.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: WebGL  (Canvas 3D)
features.summary: 3D rendering via the <canvas> element.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser and may not be complete. All or some of the relevant API names have a vendor prefix (or other experimental prefix, like X- or experimental-). API signatures and behavior may not necessarily match the latest iteration of the standard.

features.name: WebGL Instancing Extension
features.summary: A way to use the GPU to quickly draw a lot of copies of a single object. In some scenes (like a forest with a lot of trees) it is a great way to get a huge performance improvement. Requires a compatible GPU.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: WebGL Shared Resources
features.summary: Allow sharing resources between 2 or more WebGL contexts
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web MIDI API
features.summary: Defines an API supporting the MIDI protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: WebM video
features.summary: WebM is a video file format intended primarily for HTML5 video. Native support is not currently planned. However, WebM can be enabled by installing 3rd party WebM components.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web Notifications
features.summary: An API for displaying simple notifications to the user.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: WebP image format support
features.summary: WebP is an image format that provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: WebRTC Object RTC API
features.summary: Enables mobile endpoints to talk to servers and web browsers with Real-Time Communications (RTC) capabilities via native and simple JavaScript APIs
features.statusDescription: This feature is currently in development or coming soon.

features.name: WebRTC v1.0 API
features.summary: Real-time communication in the browser. See also "Web RTC - Object RTC API".
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: WebSocket
features.summary: The WebSockets JavaScript API provides a simple API for bi-directional communication with web servers. The WebSocket network protocol enables low overhead bi-directional communication with web servers over a persistent TCP connection.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: Web Speech API (input)
features.summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech recognition into their web pages.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web Speech API (synthesis)
features.summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech synthesis into their web pages.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web SQL Database
features.summary: API exposing an SQLite database
features.statusDescription: This feature is not under active consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: Web Storage
features.summary: Refers to both localStorage and sessionStorage
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.

features.name: WOFF File Format 2.0
features.summary: Based on experience with WOFF 1.0, which is widely deployed, this specification was developed to provide improved compression and thus lower use of network bandwidth, while still allowing fast decompression even on mobile devices. This is achieved by combining a content-aware preprocessing step and improved entropy coding, compared to the Flate compression used in WOFF 1.0.
features.statusDescription: The feature is under consideration for implementation in a future release.

features.name: XMLHttpRequest timeout
features.summary: Exposing the XHR timeout property and sending corresponding events such as ontimeout.
features.statusDescription: The feature is on by default in a stable release of the browser. Unless noted otherwise, all or near all of the feature is supported.
